summary: The Mariner Exam Modernization Act (H.R. 3331) aims to update and modernize the Merchant Mariner Credentialing Examination. It mandates changes to examination review processes, including the establishment of working groups with specific requirements, revised timelines, and consideration of industry standards. The bill directs the Commandant to develop a modernization plan within 270 days of review completion, encompassing the updating and removal of outdated content, modernization of testing procedures, and data collection on pass/fail rates. The Coast Guard is required to brief relevant congressional committees on the review and plan within one year of enactment.
